intro: Amecarpus, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, yellow flowers that resemble those of the true dandelion. The plant is native to various regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia, and it thrives in dry, open habitats. Amecarpus species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
